data.title: A symbol of a bygone era
data.text:
As we were leaving the Los Angeles area we took the Foothills Blvd (the historic route 66) thru some of the foothills communities...places like Glendora,Claremont,and
San Dimas but when we were going thru Rancho Cucamonga I was pleasantly surprised to see this old school gas station with its' old fashioned gas pumps. Unfortunately it's fenced in at the moment but hopefully it will open to the public maybe as a Route 66 visitor info center or a local museum of that bygone era. 
With its' bright yellow color and apparently pristine condition I just had to take a photo. If you find yourself in the area I'd suggest you visit the cute little yellow gas station that must've fueled so many cars along the iconic Route 66!

data.title: Old gas pumper
data.text: It's not an attraction. It was a run down, dilapidated gas station brought back to life. No gas available. A tired, rundown building now painted so the new stores being constructed next door don't have to deal with an eyesore.

data.title: Rancho Service Station
data.text: If your looking for an old time Route 66 filling station, this is the place to take your old classic car to take some cool photos.

data.title: nice to see a bit of history.
data.text: Stopped across the road at The Deli and noticed this place. It appears to be fenced off at the moment but is still very eye-catching, the restoration is well done.

data.title: Perhaps the best Route 66 station left.
data.text: Very nice to look at. Parking is a problem. It used to have a nice large sign on top, but apparently some electronic sign company decided it was blocking their eye-sore. What type of town allows a large electronic sign at the intersection of two major streets? Anyway, Well worth a stop. Well done, Someone obviously cares about history in this community.

data.title: Not much to it
data.text: Not a whole lot to it. Looks a lot better now that it's restored but it will take a few minutes max to see everything.

data.title: Sweet trip down memory lane
data.text: I pass this place every day. It is at Route 66 (Foothill Blvd) and Archibald. Site of an old school gas station on the classic American Main Street. Makes me smile every day.

data.title: Great Job By the Route 66 Inland Empire CA
data.text:
I remember seeing this station while traveling Route 66 in 2008. There was a fence around it, and it was falling apart. 

Now thanks to some great people at the Route 66 IECA, it's not only restored, but it also houses a modest museum. 

If your heading down Route 66, it's one of the best examples of what used to be in Southern California!
